page.title: 18GLASSHAMPTON MONASTERY
page.content: The monastery used to be the stables of Glasshampton Manor which was burned down.In{1919 William Sirr,}a member of the{Society of the Divine Compassion founded a house of prayer there, but his stern self-discipline was not easy to follow and none of those who came stayed. It is now used by the{Society {of Saint Francis}as a house of prayer. There are seven brothers living there some of whom are elderly. The friary takes in novices who stay for six months.The brothers tend the garden and grow some of their own food but are not self-sufficient.They keep bees. The friary does not have a television but some of the brothers have radios. The chapel is a simple room with white walls and red sandstone altar.Bells are rung at 7.00am.,12.40pm.,6.00pm. and 9.00pm. before worship together in chapel.
